ruleset.name: Empty Code
ruleset.description: The Empty Code ruleset contains rules that find empty statements of any kind (empty method, empty block statement, empty try or catch block,...).

rule.name: EmptyCatchBlock
rule.description: Empty Catch Block finds instances where an exception is caught, but nothing is done. In most circumstances, this swallows an exception which should either be acted on or reported.

property.name: allowCommentedBlocks
property.description: Empty blocks containing comments will be skipped

rule.name: EmptyIfStmt
rule.description: Empty If Statement finds instances where a condition is checked but nothing is done about it.

rule.name: EmptyWhileStmt
rule.description: Empty While Statement finds all instances where a while statement does nothing. If it is a timing loop, then you should use Thread.sleep() for it; if it is a while loop that does a lot in the exit expression, rewrite it to make it clearer.

rule.name: EmptyTryBlock
rule.description: Avoid empty try blocks - what's the point?

rule.name: EmptyFinallyBlock
rule.description: Empty finally blocks serve no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptySwitchStatements
rule.description: Empty switch statements serve no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptySynchronizedBlock
rule.description: Empty synchronized blocks serve no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptyStatementNotInLoop
rule.message: An empty statement (semicolon) not part of a loop
rule.description: An empty statement (or a semicolon by itself) that is not used as the sole body of a 'for' or 'while' loop is probably a bug. It could also be a double semicolon, which has no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptyInitializer
rule.description: Empty initializers serve no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptyStatementBlock
rule.description: Empty block statements serve no purpose and should be removed.

rule.name: EmptyStaticInitializer
rule.description: An empty static initializer serve no purpose and should be removed.
